course.title: Calculus with Applications to Biology II

activities.name: LA Community Learning Sessions
activities.details: Attend and participate in weekly LA sessions

activities.name: Pre-lecture Assignments (PLAs)
activities.details: Complete before each MWF class. Score at least 80% for full XP.

activities.name: Online Homework
activities.details: Due weekly on Mondays. XP score based on percentage of available points.

activities.name: Target Practice
activities.details: Available for each Learning Target. XP score based on percentage of available points.

activities.name: Quiz sign-ups and surveys
activities.details: Brief reflection survey and quiz sign up.

targets.title: Review topics from Calculus I
targets.description: Demonstrate proficiency in computing definite integrals using antiderivatives, signed area, and properties of the definite integral.
targets.f_description: Demonstrate proficiency in computing definite integrals using antiderivatives, signed area, and properties of the definite integral.
targets.adv_description: Demonstrate proficiency in conceptual understanding of the definite integral and its applications.
f_objectives: Use Evaluation Theorem for integral computation
adv_objectives: Distinguish definite integrals as numbers vs. indefinite as families
Construct definite integrals from verbal descriptions

targets.title: Integration by Substitution
targets.description: Demonstrate proficiency in performing integration by substitution.
targets.f_description: Demonstrate proficiency in performing integration by substitution.
targets.adv_description: Apply substitution method to definite integrals with proper change of variables.
adv_objectives: Make variable changes in definite integrals

targets.title: Integration by Parts
targets.description: Use the integration by parts method to compute indefinite integrals.
targets.f_description: Use the integration by parts method to compute indefinite integrals.
targets.adv_description: Use integration by parts to compute definite integrals and combine with other methods.
f_objectives: Recognize when integration by parts is appropriate
Demonstrate an understanding of the integration by parts rule and its connection with the product rule for derivatives
adv_objectives: Compute definite integrals using integration by parts
Combine integration by parts with other techniques

targets.title: Integration by Partial Fractions
targets.description: Perform partial fraction decomposition for rational functions.
targets.f_description: Perform partial fraction decomposition for rational functions.
targets.adv_description: Compute integrals using partial fraction decomposition.
f_objectives: Decompose rational functions into partial fractions.
adv_objectives: Integrate rational functions using partial fractions
Recognize when partial fractions is appropriate

targets.title: Integration Techniques
targets.description: Demonstrate proficiency in identifying and applying appropriate integration techniques from LT1-LT4.
targets.f_description: Demonstrate proficiency in identifying and applying appropriate integration techniques from LT1-LT4.
f_objectives: Identify which integration technique to apply
Select between substitution, parts, and partial fractions

targets.title: Modeling with Differential Equations
targets.description: Create differential equation models from verbal descriptions.
targets.f_description: Create differential equation models from verbal descriptions.
targets.adv_description: Verify solutions to differential equations.
f_objectives: Create differential equation models from verbal descriptions
Determine the order of a differential equation
adv_objectives: Verify solutions for first-order differential equations
Verify solutions for second-order differential equations
Determine particular solutions from initial conditions

targets.title: Separation of Variables
targets.description: Demonstrate proficiency in identifying separable first-order differential equations.
targets.f_description: Demonstrate proficiency in identifying separable first-order differential equations.
targets.adv_description: Solve separable differential equations and find particular solutions.
f_objectives: Find general solutions in implicit form
adv_objectives: Find particular solutions from initial conditions

targets.title: The Integrating Factor Method
targets.description: Demonstrate understanding of the integrating factor method.
targets.f_description: Demonstrate understanding of the integrating factor method.
targets.adv_description: Apply the integrating factor method to solve differential equations.
adv_objectives: Understand connection to product rule derivative
Find general solutions using integrating factors
Find particular solutions from initial conditions

targets.title: Linear Models in Biology
targets.description: Construct differential equation models, find solutions, and interpret results in biological contexts.
targets.f_description: Construct differential equation models, find solutions, and interpret results in biological contexts.
targets.notes: Synthesis target combining modeling and solution techniques.
f_objectives: Construct differential equation models from biological scenarios

targets.title: Slope Fields
targets.description: Demonstrate proficiency in constructing slope fields for first-order differential equations.
targets.f_description: Demonstrate proficiency in constructing slope fields for first-order differential equations.
targets.adv_description: Interpret slope fields and sketch solution curves.
f_objectives: Sketch slope fields for differential equations
adv_objectives: Sketch solution curves on slope fields
Recognize equilibrium solutions from slope fields
Analyze long-term behavior from slope fields

targets.title: Phase Lines and Equilibrium Solutions
targets.description: Demonstrate proficiency in constructing phase lines and identifying equilibrium solutions.
targets.f_description: Demonstrate proficiency in constructing phase lines and identifying equilibrium solutions.
targets.adv_description: Analyze equilibrium solutions and long-run behavior.
f_objectives: Construct phase lines for autonomous equations
Identify stable, unstable, and semi-stable equilibria
adv_objectives: Interpret equilibrium solutions in biological contexts
Reason about long-run behavior across initial conditions

targets.title: Bifurcation Diagrams
targets.description: Demonstrate understanding of bifurcation diagrams and parameter effects on differential equation behavior.
targets.f_description: Demonstrate understanding of bifurcation diagrams and parameter effects on differential equation behavior.
targets.notes: Group assessment combining graphical analysis with parameter interpretation.
f_objectives: Describe qualitative behavior changes at bifurcations
Analyze parameter effects on long-run behavior

targets.title: Integration Computation and Applications
targets.description: Demonstrate proficiency in identifying and applying appropriate integration techniques in applied contexts.
targets.f_description: Demonstrate proficiency in identifying and applying appropriate integration techniques in applied contexts.
f_objectives: Select appropriate integration technique for a given problem
Apply integration to solve application problems

targets.title: Vector Operations
targets.description: Demonstrate proficiency in fundamental vector operations.
targets.f_description: Demonstrate proficiency in fundamental vector operations.
targets.adv_description: Apply vector operations in geometric and applied contexts.
f_objectives: Express vectors using standard basis vectors

targets.title: Linear Transformations
targets.description: Demonstrate proficiency working with linear transformations.
targets.f_description: Demonstrate proficiency working with linear transformations.
targets.adv_description: Construct matrix representations of linear transformations.
f_objectives: Apply linear transformations via basis vectors
adv_objectives: Compose linear transformations using matrix multiplication

targets.title: Matrix Operations
targets.description: Demonstrate proficiency in basic matrix operations.
targets.f_description: Demonstrate proficiency in basic matrix operations.
targets.adv_description: Apply advanced matrix operations.

targets.title: Discrete Dynamical Systems
targets.description: Create linear multivariable discrete time models from verbal descriptions.
targets.f_description: Create linear multivariable discrete time models from verbal descriptions.
targets.adv_description: Analyze and interpret discrete dynamical systems.
adv_objectives: Describe long-term behavior of discrete systems

targets.title: The Inverse Matrix
targets.description: Demonstrate understanding of inverse matrices.
targets.f_description: Demonstrate understanding of inverse matrices.
targets.adv_description: Apply inverse matrices in modeling contexts.
f_objectives: Verify if a matrix is invertible
Apply inverse matrices to solve systems
adv_objectives: Understand relationship between inverse and determinant

targets.title: Gaussian Elimination
targets.description: Represent systems using matrices and use row operations.
targets.f_description: Represent systems using matrices and use row operations.
targets.adv_description: Solve systems using Gaussian elimination.

targets.title: Eigenvalues and Eigenvectors
targets.description: Compute eigenvalues and eigenvectors.
targets.f_description: Compute eigenvalues and eigenvectors.
targets.adv_description: Apply eigenvalue analysis and understand geometric meaning.

targets.title: Solving Discrete Time Matrix Models
targets.description: Find closed form solutions of iterated matrix models.
targets.f_description: Find closed form solutions of iterated matrix models.
targets.adv_description: Analyze long-term behavior of discrete matrix models.
f_objectives: Determine eigenvalues and eigenvectors of transition matrices
Decompose initial states into eigenvector components

targets.title: Markov Models
targets.description: Create Markov models from verbal descriptions.
targets.f_description: Create Markov models from verbal descriptions.
targets.adv_description: Analyze long-term behavior of Markov models.
adv_objectives: Use dominant eigenvalue for long-run analysis

targets.title: Interpreting Discrete Time Matrix Models
targets.description: Use data from iterated matrix models to analyze behavior.
targets.f_description: Use data from iterated matrix models to analyze behavior.
targets.adv_description: Analyze parameter effects on model behavior.
f_objectives: Apply dominant eigenvalue to determine long-run behavior
Understand role of complex eigenvalues in oscillations
adv_objectives: Determine effects of varying parameter entries
Connect eigenvalue changes to behavioral changes

targets.title: Linear Systems of Differential Equations
targets.description: Express systems in matrix-vector form and find solutions.
targets.f_description: Express systems in matrix-vector form and find solutions.
targets.adv_description: Analyze behavior of linear systems.
adv_objectives: Write general solutions as linear combinations

targets.title: Nonlinear Systems of Differential Equations
targets.description: Demonstrate understanding of phase-plane method for analyzing nonlinear systems.
targets.f_description: Demonstrate understanding of phase-plane method for analyzing nonlinear systems.
targets.notes: Group assessment during Week 15 combining graphical and analytical methods.

quiz_schedule.tuesday_notes: LT1F is a Group Quiz during the Week 2 Session
